review_title: Working here will crush your spirit
pros: Most faculty members are committed to teaching.
cons: Administrative leadership is inept. School operates at a massive deficit, lacks any tech sophistication, and grossly mismanages campus data. Facilities are in poor condition. Lots of time spent highlighting their “practices and principles.” I’ve never seen leaders and HR professionals treat colleagues with less dignity.

job_title: Junior Student Web Developer in Richmond, IN
pros: Love working here, very kind and helpful folks. Work is flexible.
cons: Can be difficult to learn from such a small team.

pros: It gave me great perspective for every job I will ever have after that. No matter what happens at any future job, I can always say, "well, at least it's not as bad as working at Earlham....."
cons: Terrible morale. In spite of lofty "principals and practices", people really did not treat each other nicely here. The current president (Ann Houptman) is ridiculously self-serving and mean-spirited.

job_title: Peer Career Coach in Richmond, IN
pros: Good work environment, Flexible, communication
cons: -I have none for them

pros: The company offers you a lot of opportunity to try new things and grow in experience.  The culture is very relaxed and fun.
cons: The company does not compensate you for said growth in a fair way.  You are basically getting resume fodder instead of monetary compensation.  There are also very few career opportunities once employed and it is pretty hard to move within the company.  There is no defined ladder to climb, if that is something you care about.

review_title: One of the Best Departments to Work for!
job_title: Public Safety Officer in Richmond, IN
pros: Upper management was available for questions and answers often, the compensation is great, they usually offer free admission to the employee to all on campus events, dealing with many diverse cultures, feeling welcome by everyone at the college, and opportunities to learn new skills. I worked the night shift and still got to know many of the people from the college during business hours.
cons: The only con I have is that I had 12-hour shifts but I also signed on for them. Some days I like the 12 hours though.

pros:
Meaningful work
It feels great to help people learn new things and understand the concepts that they are taught
Enjoyed my conversations with my supervisor
cons:
The pay is bad- only 7.25 USD an hour. 
Can only work 10 hours a week 
Sometimes overworked but cannot log the hours

job_title: Lead Web Developer in Richmond, IN
pros:
Flexibility to self manage, Relaxed environment. Diversity Focused. Pay is pretty Good for Indiana.
Small School which allows each person to have a bigger impact to make a difference
cons: The location of parking areas seem to be in odd locations for most buildings. The sidewalks seem to be going everywhere.

pros: The people at Earlham really care about students and one another. Benefits packages are excellent. The college has a strong reputation within higher education.
cons: Like most of higher education, the pay is only so-so. The college has been going through strategic planning, which has added some tension to campus.

pros: Small college community with some good people interested in change and innovation.
cons: Large systematic and underlying data issues that make it extremely difficult to be successful. Most information that comes out of here regarding data and "truth" should be suspect and questioned. Toxic environment with a "we don't do that here" response to any true innovation or industry best practice. HR issues are rampant.

pros: Provides fundraising experience, line manager engages lots of team-building activities outside of monotonous calling job. Small incentives like gift cards and goody bags provided every once in a while.
cons: Mechanical, monotonous work. Most calls go to answering machine, and many prospects hang up in a pretty hostile way.

job_title: Creative Administrative Job in Richmond, IN
pros: The immediate team I worked with were talented and supportive
cons: Hypocrisy, constant leadership turnover, reinventing the wheel, mistrust, helicopter administration

pros: The people at Earlham are wonderful, cooperative, and the students are top-notch.
cons: While some structural and systemic challenges were addressed, others appeared. Some people experienced frustration with recent institutional decisions, such as getting rid of the football program.

pros: The people that I worked with were great.
